  • Method Details

    • getFileName

      public String getFileName()
      Creates a display that prompts the player for a file name
      Returns:
      String, the file name entered by the player

    • promptsFileWhileExiting

      public String promptsFileWhileExiting()
      Prompts the player for a file name to save the game when he/she tries to exit
      Returns:
      String, the file name entered by the player

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame(Tile[][] board, boolean yourTurn, boolean whitesTurn)
      Accepts a .txt file containing board data. Writes the chess board data to a .txt file specified by the player. FILE FORMAT: COLOR PIECE (X,Y) EXAMPLE: BLACK PAWN (1,1)
      Parameters:
      board - - 8X8 2D board containing the Tiles and Pieces
      yourTurn - - boolean, the turn of this laptop's owner
      whitesTurn - - boolean, the white's turn

    • loadGame

      public boolean[] loadGame(Tile[][] board)
      Accepts a .txt file containing board data. Loads the pieces to the 2D board based on the file data FILE FORMAT: COLOR PIECE (X,Y) EXAMPLE: BLACK PAWN (1,1)
      Parameters:
      board - - 8X8 2D board containing the Tiles and Pieces
      Returns:
      an array of boolean vals which indicate your turn and the white's turn

    • setFileName

      public void setFileName(String name)
      Sets the file name
      Parameters:
      name - String, file name

    • addPieceToBoard

      private void addPieceToBoard(Tile[][] board, String pieceInfo)
      Adds a piece to the 2D chess board Accepts a 2D board and piece information
      Parameters:
      board - - 8X8 2D board containing the Tiles and Pieces
      pieceInfo - - String info about the piece

    • checkForSavedGamesFolder

      private void checkForSavedGamesFolder()
      Checks the current directory to see if there is a "Saved Games" folder It will create the folder if it doesn't exit. "Saved Games" folder is used to store the saved games.

    • createPiece

      private Piece createPiece(String pName, String color)
      Creates a chess piece based on the given piece name Returns null if it takes an invalid piece name
      Parameters:
      pName - String piece name
      color - - String color of the piece
      Returns:
      the created Piece or null if passed an invalid piece name
